title: Syllabus - Introduction to statistics and business analytics - Fall 2025
text:
Course Description
Introduction to statistical and business analytic methods used in the analysis of business decisions. Covers issues involving data and data collection, descriptive statistics and data visualization issues. Reviews the use of probability and probability distributions in business decisions. Introduction to sampling and sampling distributions, development of statistical estimation and statistical inference, including confidence intervals for means and proportions, analysis of variance, and various hypothesis tests. Develops correlation, simple linear regression, and introduces simple time series analysis and decision analysis methods

title: Syllabus - Introduction to statistics and business analytics - Fall 2025
text:
Grading Breakdown

Homework: 15%
Examinations: 25% each (2 exams)
Group Activities: 5%
Final Exam: 30%

You will NOT be allowed any extra credit projects to compensate for a poor average. The final grade is based on the following scale:

Note: No late homework will be accepted, and no make-up work will be allowed unless in the case of an emergency. Submit incomplete work if necessary, but ensure scanned PDFs are legible before submission.

title: Syllabus - Introduction to statistics and business analytics - Fall 2025
text:
Homework Policy
Homework is required for a better understanding of the material and must be submitted to D2L. No late homework will be accepted, and two homework assignments will be dropped. It is recommended to submit even incomplete work. You can scan your homework and submit it as a PDF, but ensure it is readable.

title: Syllabus - Introduction to statistics and business analytics - Fall 2025
text:
Attendance Policy
Attendance is required, and the College of Business Administration will be observed.

title: Syllabus - Introduction to statistics and business analytics - Fall 2025
text:
Make-up Policy
There will be no make-up exams or homework unless there is an emergency.
